sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Miscellaneous Compilation including Old English Material and Historical and Philosophical Works
Chronica. Anglo-Saxon fragments, etc.
msDesc.p: Paper and vellum, 220 145 , 8.5 x 5.5, ff. 53 + 52, five volumes of cent. xv, xi-xii, xiv, xi respectively.

Volume II: Six leaves in a smallish hand of cent. xi-xii: 35 lines to a page.
Volume III: Double columns of 43 lines. Cent. xiii-xiv, black hand.
Volume IV: Double columns of 32 lines. Cent. xiii, red initial.
Volume V: 22 lines to a page: a fine minuscule of cent. xi? Initials filled with red.
Collation: Paper: 110 210 312 (wants 10-12) 414 510. Vellum: a2 b2 c2 d4 e2 (2 canc.) f6 (6 canc.) 814 (10 canc.)? A12. B (three). I8 (wants 1, 7, 8) II2 (+1).
Part of the volume seems to be certainly from Worcester.
The Anglo-Saxon portions were not described by Wanley and have escaped the notice of subsequent students.

msItem.head: Ranulf Higden OSB, Polychronicon (epitome and continuation to 1429)

head.title: Epitome chronicae Cicestrensis, sed extractum e Polychronico, usque ad annum Christi 1429

msItem.incipit: Ieronimus ad eugenium in epistola 43a dicit quod decime leguntur primum date ab abraham
msItem.ab: Dates are marked in the margin
Ends with the coronation of Henry VI at St Denis
msItem.explicit: videlicet nono die mensis decembris ano etatis sue 10o

msItem.head: Thomas Harsfield, Gesta regum ad Henricum VI

head.title: Breviarium historiae Angliae ad annum quartum Henrici IV. viz. 1402

msItem.ab: begins with 19 lines

lg.l: Albion est terra constans in finibus orbis
Quam dedit albina grecorum filia regis
Succedunt Reges ab eodem pace fruentes
Usque dies nostres ut pandunt scripta legentes
Ex libris quorum labor hic monstratur aperte

msItem.incipit: Et quia confrater carissime non solum audiendo sacre scripture verbis aurem sedulus auditor accomodatur (!) tenetur
msItem.ab: (See P. de Yckham)
Ends with verses (14) on the Battle of Shrewsbury
de isto bello quidam versificator sic infert versus

lg.l: Henrico IIIIto sunt hec anno sibi iiijto
Nescio plus quorum Christus miseretur eorum

msItem.explicit: Tempore huius regis Owynus quidam Wallensis erigens se in principem Wallie toto vite sue tempore cum Wallensibus rebellauit
msItem.ab: Lower part of leaf cut off. f. 53v blank

msItem.head: Ćlfric OSB, De temporibus anni (incomplete)

head.title: De die, mense, de XII signis, &c. (Saxonice)

msItem.incipit: Þone forman dćg ţyssere ƿorulde ƿe magon afindan ţurh ţes lenctenlices emnihtes dćg. Forţan đe se emnihtes dćg is se feorđa dćg ţyssere ƿorulde gesceapennysse
msItem.ab: Treats de luna, de ebdomada, de anno solis, de xii signis, de anno, de diuersis mensibus, de luna, communis annus, embolismus, IIIIor tempora
On f. 2v the writing is crowded towards the end. Ends
msItem.explicit: Eft on langiendum dagum he ofer geđ ţone suđran sunsted ˇ 7 forţi he byđ norţur geseƿen ţonne seo sunne on ƿintra ˇ sƿa ţeah ne gćđ heora
msItem.ab: It continues on ff. 7r-10r
msItem.incipit: nađor ćnne pricon ofer ţam ţe him geset is. ne dagas ne synd nu naţor lengran ne scyrtran ţonne hi ćt fruman ƿćron. en Egyptaland ne cymđ nćfre nan ƿinter
msItem.ab: Ends f. 10r (on hail, snow, thunder, etc.)
msItem.explicit: se biđ hlud for ţćre lyfte bradnysse. frecen ful for ţćs fyres sceotugum. beo ţeos gesetnyss ţus her ge endod
msItem.ab: f. 10v blank
This is Ælfric's extract from Beda de temporibus. Cockayne, Leechdoms III 238
A good hand of cent. xii, 30 lines to a page
Homily on the Assumption
ff. 6r-6v should precede ff. 3r-3v (Thorpe II 436)
msItem.incipit: be ţisse heofenlican cƿene upstige
msItem.ab: f. 6v ends
ţćt heo un asecgendlice mid criste up
ahafen on ecnysse rixige
Ends f. 5r. f. 23r has the beginning

msItem.incipit: Ƿyrd ƿryteras secgađ ţćt ţre leod scipas

Omnibus ... Walt. de La Fort (?) ... Noueritis me dedisse ... Philipp. filio meo quatuor croppos ... in camp de Henton ... ao v. v. H. Liiio ... Test. Joh. Jokyn. Le Fraunke

msItem.incipit: Men ţa leofestan ƿeorđiat ƿe nu on andƿeardnysse ţa gebyr tide
msItem.ab: (Wanley, p. 17, Bodl. NEF. 4. 12)
Ends imperfectly
msItem.explicit: He ţa ioseph aros of ţam slćpe. sƿy ţe ge

On the Lord's Prayer, continued on f. 29r
msItem.incipit: ure rice gif ƿe hit geearnian ƿyllan

17v ends
Đćt fifte gebed is. Et dimitte nobis debita nostra sicut et nos dimittimus (29r) debitoribus nostris
ends
msItem.explicit: Sƿa he oftor on ţćre fandunge
msItem.ab: f. 18r follows f. 27v. Homily on Dedication of St Michael's Church. Thorpe II 502 (fragments)
f. 19r follows f. 28r. Homily on St Matthew. Thorpe II 468
f. 20r-20v, the end of a Homily and beginning of another
msItem.incipit: Hit is sƿyđe ged(a)fenlic

f. 21r-21v single leaf
msItem.incipit: fram ţroƿunge to ćriste. fra deđe to life

msItem.explicit: ţa ţa heo ƿearđ a ţys trođ on cristes ţroƿunge fram middćge ođ non. stanas on

msItem.incipit: gafol ođđe tol. ćt heora gesiblingum ođđe ćt frćmdum. Petrus cƿæð ćt frćmdum. Se hćlend cƿćđ, etc.
msItem.ab: Ends
msItem.explicit: him for godes lufan big ƿiste fore sceaƿađ. Đon hćfđ he sƿa miccle
msItem.ab: (On Matt. xvii 24, the fish and tribute-money)
Apparently not found elsewhere: not known to Professor Napier
see a. Homily on the Assumption
see b. On St Bartholomew
I append a copy of the fragment m.

fram gode ˇ to ţe cumen ˇ ; Ic ƿes ţine ƿlite ˇ 7 ţine
ƿynsumnesse ˇ 7 ţine spćc 7 ţin haƿung ˇ 7 ţine gehyrnys ˇ 7 ţine glednesse; Ic ƿćs ţin geţanc ˇ 7
ţine fćgernes ˇ 7 ţine lufu ˇ 7 ţin gestćţţignes
7 ţin ge treoƿnes ˇ gif ţu ćnige treoƿa hćfdest; 7 ic
ƿćs ţin gamon ˇ 7 ţin gladung ˇ 7 ţin hleahtor ˇ 7 ţine
myrhţ. Eall þæt ţu ƿćre. eall ic ƿćs ţis on ţe 7
siţ ţan ic ana ƿćs of ţe ˇ eall ţe lofode ˇ þæt ic nu
sćde; 7 naht ţu ƿćre butan me ˇ 7 ţu me mid enigum
gode ne ge ţohtest. ne ţinne drihten. ţe me ţe
sealde. Ladlice eardunge hćfde ic on ţe ˇ ćghƿćt
ţćs ţe ţu hogedest mid ţinum flćsce ćghƿćt me
ƿćs ţćs earfodlic ˇ on to ge ţroƿianne Eall þæt ţu
lufodest. eall þæt ic hatode nćre ƿit nćfre gletane tid on anum ƿillan. For ţan ţe ţu hyrƿdest
godes bebodu ˇ 7 his haligra lare; Eala eala hreoƿlice ˇ 7 dreorlice. stent ţonne þæt deade flesc asmórod
ne mćg ţonne nan andƿyrde syllan. ţam his gaste.
7 sƿćst sƿiţe ladlicum sƿate ˇ 7 him feallađ of. | unfćgere dropan ˇ 7 bret on menige fealdum
hiƿe. Hƿilum he biđ sƿiđe ladlicum men gelice ˇ ţonne
ƿannaţ he 7 doxađ ˇ oţre hƿile he biđ blac ˇ 7 ćm /heoƿe ˇ 7 hƿilum coll sƿeart ˇ 7 gelic ţam seo saƿul. heo
ƿađ on yfelan bleon sƿa same ˇ sƿa se lichama ˇ
7 biđ gyt ƿyrsan heoƿes; 7 standađ butu ˇ sƿiţe
forhte ˇ 7 afćrede ˇ 7 bifiende on bidat domes; Đonne clypađ se deofol to ţam déman ˇ 7 cƿiţ to him
ţes ƿes min agen ˇ fram hire geogođe ođ hire
ylde ˇ heo hyrdon me georne 7 ćlce dćg ic
heo lćrde unriht to donne ˇ 7 hi me simble
lustlice hyrdon. And ţonne ţin lareoƿ com to hym 7
hym ƿolde hyra saƿla hćlo ˇ tetan ˇ ţonne ƿćs ic
f. 25v
simle ćr ćt heom ˇ 7 ćft leng ˇ 7 sƿette heom heora / unriht ˇ la hƿi ne mot ic habban ˇ þæt ic ćr me sylf
begeat mid minum lyđrum ƿrencum ˇ oft ic gedyde ˇ
þæt he geƿorhte ţussende synna ƿiđ đe ˇ 7 nane
ge betan nolde ˇ Đonne cƿćđ ţćs ređan cininges
stef ˇ gang ţu saƿel in þæt forlorene hus. ţa git
ćt somne syngodon. git eac ćt somne sƿelton; Donne cƿiđ ćft se dema to ţam saƿlum. Discedite
a me maledicti in ignem eternum qui preparatus
est (a) diabolo. Geƿitaţ ge aƿirgydan on þæt ece
fyr ˇ þæt gegearƿode min fćder deofle 7 his
englum. Đonne hćfđ se deofol geƿorht bogan
7 strćla. 7 se boga biţ geƿoht of ofer mettum ˇ
7 ţa strela beođ sƿa manigra cynna sƿa sƿa mannes synna beođ. Sum strćl biţ geƿorht of
niţe sum of ćfeste. sum of eţ belige ˇ sum
of hat heortnćsse ˇ sum of stale ˇ sum of
drucennesse ˇ sum of dyrnum geligere ˇ sum
of ćƿ bryce ˇ sum of sib legere sum of dƿolcrćfte ˇ sum of lyblacc ˇ sum of gitsunge ˇ sum
of gifernesse ˇ sum of reaflac ˇ sum of scincrćfte
sum of mord cƿale ˇ sum of strudunge. And
sƿa manega strćla hćfd se deofol sƿa nis nan
man þæt hy ealle atellan magon. And ćlce dćg
ţćs deofoles ƿilla biđ þæt his strelena nan ˇ
ne sy unafćstnod ˇ gif he findan mćg hƿćr
he hy on afćstnian mćge. 7 on hćlle ţa
deofla scotigađ mid ţam strćlum ˇ 7 sƿa sa he
hćfđ ćlce dćg his bogan to us gebendne
7 ƿile us scotian mid ţam strćlum ˇ ţe ic ćr / nemde; Đonne is us micel ţearf leofan men
þæt ƿe habban ţa scyldas ţćr ongean ˇ ţe /
f. 26r follows 20v: see g.
f. 27r-27v precedes 18r (on St Matthew and St Michael): see e., f.
Exaltation of the Cross (fragments). Morris, Legends of the Holy Rood, E. E. T. S., pp. 105, 107. Also on 28v the beginning of the Homily on St Matthew. p. thus precedes f. 18r
On the Lord's Prayer: see d.

msItem.head: Robert Kilwardby OP, De natura relationis
msItem.rubric: Que sit res predicamenti relationis per se
msItem.incipit: De predicamento relationis querunt aliqui que sit res huius generis
msItem.ab: Ends imperfectly in chapter 31
(Wright, Poems of W. Mapes, p. 1)
msItem.incipit: A tauro torrida lampade cinthii
msItem.ab: Ending
msItem.explicit: Dux meus manibus me capit insitis

msItem.ab: beginning imperfectly in c. ii
msItem.incipit: forma. perfusus diuina dilectione et gratia deo et hominibus amabilis erat aetatula
msItem.ab: The original hand ends in c. viii: diuinorum miracula beneficiorum commendant. A hand of cent. xii continues and, writing very close, ends on the same page. It begins: martirem suum quem et ab humana noticia abscidere nitebatur: and ends: occubuerit. ad laudem et gloriam dei patris omnipotentis qui uiuit et regnat per omnia secula seculorum. Amen

ab.decoNote: Under this is a scribble of a maze in pencil

msItem.ab: The same Life (abridged in Acta Sanctorum July IV 380, and in Horstmann, Nova Legenda Angliae II 110) is in MS. Douce 368 and Bodley 285

On the verso a line and a half in a small hand giving a list of books.
.i. Đeo englissce passionale ˇ 7 .ii. ˇiiˇ englissce dialogas ˇ 7 .iii. oddan boc ˇ 7 .iiii. ţe englisca martirlogium ˇ / 7 .vi. ˇ ii ˇ englisce ˇ salteras 7 ˇ ii ˇ pastorales ˇ englisce ˇ 7 ţe englisca regol. / 7 barontus.
(Printed in my Sources of Archbishop Parker's Collection and in Floyer and Hamilton's Catalogue of the MSS. at Worcester Cathedral, p. 166, note 3.) Barontus is the Vision of Barontus of Pistoia Acta Sanctorum Mart. 24

ab.handNote: In a hand similar to that of the booklist in item 7 but larger

msItem.ab: Title in faint pencil
msItem.incipit: Her gesutelađ đa gesihđe đe Leofric eorl gesćh. him ţuhte to sođan on healf slapendon lichaman na eallinga sƿylce on sƿefne ac gyt geƿisslicor þæt he sceolde nede ofer ane sƿiđe smale bricge ˇ 7 seo ƿćr sƿiţe lang
msItem.ab: Ends
msItem.explicit: hit ţa gesƿac ţćra bletsunga þæt ƿćs neh ţam ţes godspel ƿćs gerćdd. Feoƿertyne nihton ćr his forđ siđe he foresćde ţonne dćg ţe he sceolde cuman to cofantreo to his langan hame ţćr he on restet ˇ 7 hit ŕ eode eall sƿa he sćde. Requiescat in pace
msItem.ab: This document, which had remained unnoticed, has been printed by Professor Napier in the Philological Journal, 1908
A note (xiii)
msItem.incipit: Vesperus est grandis interpolatio nubium inter nos et solem
msItem.ab: In a hand like that of no. 8 with neumes. Sequence for Epiphany

lg.l: Regem regum intacte profudit thorus res miranda
Sanctus namque spiritus ipsa nobis prebuit bene mentis naribus odoranda

msItem.ab: Ad ultimum laus est uincta. Psalat chorus alia. Amen dicant omnia
msItem.incipit: Hubertus (l. Herbertus) Abbas Westmon. 7 Edwius prior eiusdem loci. uenerabili priori Wigornie / Warino et domino Vhtredo cantori ceterisque fratribus ecclesie eiusdem. salutem in christo et perpet(uam) / pacem. Sciatis istum fratrem nostrum et monachum Benedictum ad nos uenisse et causa(s) / recessurus (!) sui de Maluernia sicut nobis uidetur rationabiliter ostendisse
msItem.ab: Asks that he be well treated till the writer's coming
dixit nobis quoddam opus scilicet missale apud uos / incepisse et antequam ad Maluerniam rediret sua uoluntate perficeret
The monk in question has left Malvern and gone to Westminster
Ends
msItem.explicit: laudando creatorem qui ouem suam reduxit ad gregem. Vale
msItem.ab: Herbertus was Abbot of Westminster from 1121 till shortly before 1140. Warinus prior of Worcester cir. 1130-40
Charm (xii?)
msItem.incipit: + In nomine p. et f. et s. sci amen + Ire + arex + Christe + rauex + filiax + / arafax + N. Medicina contra febres
msItem.ab: On f. 52v in a neat small hand, beginning and margin cut: Constitutions affecting monks, etc.
The last begins
msItem.incipit: Monachis et canonicis regularibus tam uestimenta quam coopertoria interdicimus colorata
Viri religiosi quibus non est cura animarum commissa nullos ad penitentiam recipere audeant
Decimas uel in canonicas sanctiones ecclesiis ad quas pertinent precipimus cum integritate persolui
